conclusion: Analyze forces acting on sled and child to determine normal force exerted by ground.
Identify forces acting on sled: applied force, weight, normal force, frictional force.
Resolve applied force into horizontal and vertical components.
Given values: applied force 100 N, angle 37 degrees, gravitational acceleration 10 m/s^2.
Calculate horizontal component of applied force: 80 N.
Calculate vertical component of applied force: 60 N.
Determine net force in vertical direction must be zero for constant speed.
Calculate total mass of sled and child: 40 kg.
Calculate weight of sled and child: 400 N.
Vertical component of applied force is 60 N.
Normal force must balance weight and vertical component of applied force.
Determine magnitude of pressure exerted by sled on ground using normal force.
Assume pressure is normal force per unit area if area were known.
Magnitude of pressure exerted by sled on ground is 460 N.
